metadata.Title: CVE-2023-5217 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
Heap buffer overflow in vp8 encoding in libvpx in Google Chrome prior to117.0.5938.132 and libvpx 1.13.1 allowed a remote attacker to potentiallyexploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium securityseverity: High)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5217` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
No subscription required

libvpx7 - 1.12.0-1ubuntu1.2
vpx-tools - 1.12.0-1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1').
mozjs78 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs102 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
libvpx package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.12.0-1ubuntu1.2').
